article:
The 'Pareto priority index (PPI)', so named because of its connection with the
Pareto principle, which is in turn named after the economist Vilfredo Pareto,
can be used to prioritize several (quality improvement) projects. It is
especially used in the surroundings of six sigma projects. It has first been
established by AT&T.

The PPI is calculated as follows:

:  \text{PPI} = \frac{\text{savings} \times \text{probability of
: success}}{\text{cost} \times \text{time of completion}}

A high PPI suggests a high project priority.
